page.title: 06HOME LIFE
page.content: As part of the survey into the areas of Brookmans Park and Welham wenoted houses which particularily caught our attention. One such house was in Brookmans Avenue. The house was 50 years old and made of ship's timbers In the front garden was an ornamental well and parked on the drive was a Triumph Stag and aTriumph Accord. The back garden is very lovely and leads on to the golf course. Inside the house there were exposed beams of oak which measured 10 inches thick.The fire was in a small inglenook which had been reduced from its original size.The stairs were also made of oak. Each of the windows had jewelled handles and the doors were covered with leather guards.In each room was a bell for servants although there were no longer any servants.They used to listen to the main kitchen signal box.
